text: does it matter Interesting food for thought   it s generally viewed as unacceptable to end your life because of the grief you may cause to those who were close to you  Suicide doesn t end pain after all  it just passes it on to somebody else   But  it s significantly more acceptable to cut ties with everyone you have ever known and move away  even though those people may not ever have a chance to speak with you again   Is it the finality of death that makes it such a big difference  as it eliminates even the smallest chance of reconciliation  Is there solace in the fact that the option may exist  no matter how unlikely it may be
summary: It's unacceptable to end your life because of the grief you may cause those who were close to you. It's more acceptable to cut ties with everyone you have ever known and move away. The finality of death makes it more acceptable.
